title: How to Open URLs on an Android Device

steps.title: Open Chrome.
steps.content: Open Chrome. It’s the round red, green, yellow, and blue icon on your home screen. If you don’t see it there, you’ll find it in the app drawer. A URL is a link that takes you to a website (e.g. https://www.wikihow.com ). They be found anywhere, such as in advertisements, business cards, or official documents.

steps.title: Tap the address bar at the top of the screen.
steps.content: Tap the address bar at the top of the screen. This opens your Android’s keyboard.

steps.title: Type the URL into the box.
steps.content: Type the URL into the box. For example, to visit wikiHow, type www.wikihow.com . You could also access wikiHow by typing https://www.wikihow.com or wikihow.com .

steps.title: Tap the enter key.
steps.content: Tap the enter key. The appearance of the key varies by device, but it may have a check mark or an arrow on it. You’ll typically find it at the bottom-right corner of the keyboard. This will open the website on your Android.

steps.title: Open the app that contains the URL.
steps.content: Open the app that contains the URL. A URL is a link that takes you to a website (e.g. https://www.wikihow.com ). The easiest way to open a URL is to click or tap a link in an app or website.

steps.title: Scroll to the URL.
steps.content: Scroll to the URL. Text URLs usually appear in a different color than the rest of the text. They may also display a picture from the website and/or a headline that describes the site.

steps.title: Tap the link.
steps.content: Tap the link. In a few seconds, your default web browser (usually Google Chrome) will display the website.
